intro: Jaborosa rotacea, commonly known as the pink milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain toxic, sticky seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments. Due to its toxic sap, it should be handled with care.
